abstract: JPMorgan’s improved offer illustrates the deep complexity and political sensitivity of the deal, which also met the rejection and anger of Bear Stearns shareholders and employees.
snippet: JPMorgan’s improved offer illustrates the deep complexity and political sensitivity of the deal, which also met the rejection and anger of Bear Stearns shareholders and employees.
lead_paragraph: Confronting a crowd of furious Bear Stearns executives last week, James Dimon’s temper suddenly flared. Pounding the table, his voice rising in anger, the chief executive of JPMorgan Chase defended the $2-a-share price he had struck for Bear Stearns as well as the government’s support of the deal.

headline.main: Seeking Fast Deal, JPMorgan Quintuples Bear Stearns Bid
headline.print_headline: Seeking Fast Deal, JPMorgan Quintuples Bear Stearns Bid

byline.original: By Landon Thomas Jr. and Eric Dash

abstract: Thanks to Visa’s blockbuster initial public offering last week, JPMorgan Chase won’t have to look very hard to come up with the extra money for its sweetened bid for Bear Stearns.
lead_paragraph: Thanks to Visa’s blockbuster initial public offering last week, JPMorgan Chase won’t have to look very hard to come up with the extra money for its sweetened bid for Bear Stearns.

headline.main: JPMorgan Reaps $1.36 Billion from Visa I.P.O.

abstract: The decision by James Dimon, JPMorgan Chase’s chief executive, to raise his bank’s bid for Bear Stearns from $2 a share to $10 dollars a share illustrates the deep complexity and political sensitivity of a deal with participants who reached into the highest corners of Washington, from the Treasury to the Federal Reserve System, according to The New York Times.
lead_paragraph: The decision by James Dimon, JPMorgan Chase’s chief executive, to raise his bank’s bid for Bear Stearns from $2 a share to $10 dollars a share illustrates the deep complexity and political sensitivity of a deal with participants who reached into the highest corners of Washington, from the Treasury to the Federal Reserve System, according to The New York Times.

headline.main: The Complexities Behind JPMorgan’s $10 Bear Offer

abstract: Now that JPMorgan Chase has quintupled to $10 a share its offer for Bear Stearns, many are asking whether this marks the end of the takeover saga, or just the beginning of a new chapter.
lead_paragraph: Now that JPMorgan Chase has quintupled to $10 a share its offer for Bear Stearns, many are asking whether this marks the end of the takeover saga, or just the beginning of a new chapter.

headline.main: Investors Betting on a Bigger Bear Bid May Disappointed

abstract: JPMorgan Chase‘s new $10 offer for Bear Stearns was certainly audacious. But just as stunning was the reach and influence of an unexpected player in the drama, according to Andrew Ross Sorkin in his weekly DealBook column.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase‘s new $10 offer for Bear Stearns was certainly audacious. But just as stunning was the reach and influence of an unexpected player in the drama, according to Andrew Ross Sorkin in his weekly DealBook column.
